intro: Oenothera webbiana, commonly known as the Webb's evening primrose, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its flowers have four petals and are characterized by their slender, tubular shape. Oenothera webbiana is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primroses and related species.
